column4: Hi, I just installed a custom kernel and noticed that automounting of usb-devices doesnt work, automounting cdroms do work though, also I can mount the usb-devices manually, anyone know what I should look for in the kernel to have automagic work for usb-devices?
why have you needed to install a custom kernel?
do you know what I should look for?
out of interest, why did you need to compile a custom kernel---if there's something you need, we'd rather get it into the default kernel
out of interest, do you know something about what might be wrong?
lots of people can probably help if you give more details.  One of the most useful things is an indication of anything you might have changed from the default config.
its a kernel.org kernel, made from scratch
the device for the usb-key is created
and hal displays it nicely in the device manager
the device is not mounted automagical and nautilus does not show the device
could be unrelated.  Is gnome-volume-manager running
can you flick back to a different kernel and see if the problem still shows up?  Then compare the output of the kernel messages/hotplug/udev/dbus for the two occasions
hmm its hard to find the source of the problem, it will probably be a while before I find it, thanks for your help so far.
